content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs a system, I executed the "browse_website" command and received a list of URLs related to octopuses. Command browse_website returned an article discussing the unique experience of being an octopus, including the mixing of centrally and peripherally controlled movements and the blurring of the border between self and environment. The author also explores the concept of agency and whether non-human animals, such as octopuses, are capable of distinguishing between events they cause and those they do not. The text argues that understanding the experience of being an octopus is a difficult but worthwhile endeavor. \n\nI generated an image of an octopus and it was saved to disk. I then used the "get_text_summary" command to retrieve a summary of an article on the website https://www.bostonreview.net/articles/peter-godfrey-smith-being-octopus/ and asked "What is the summary of the text?".'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command get_text_summary returned:  "Result" : The article explores the subjective experience of non-human animals, specifically the octopus, and the challenges of understanding their consciousness. The unique characteristics of the octopus, such as its large nervous system and distributed organization, challenge our assumptions about animal consciousness. The article also discusses the limitations of our ability to understand the experiences of other animals and the role of memory and imagination in bridging this gap. The author considers experiments with octopuses and other animals that suggest they may have some level of awareness of their actions and environment. The article argues that studying the octopus provides valuable insights into the nature of consciousness and the limits of our understanding.'}]
"""
